verses.verse: What<WG5101> shall we say<WG2046> then<WG3767> that Abraham<WG11> our<WG2257> father<WG3962>, as pertaining<WG2596> to the flesh<WG4561>, hath found<WG2147>?
For<WG1063> if<WG1487> Abraham<WG11> were justified<WG1344> by<WG1537> works<WG2041>, he hath<WG2192> whereof to glory<WG2745>; but<WG235> not<WG3756> before<WG4314> God<WG2316>.
For<WG1063> what<WG5101> saith<WG3004> the scripture<WG1124>?<WG1161> Abraham<WG11> believed<WG4100> God<WG2316>, and<WG2532> it was counted<WG3049> unto him<WG846> for<WG1519> righteousness<WG1343>.
Now<WG1161> to him that worketh<WG2038> is<WG3049> the reward<WG3408> not<WG3756> reckoned<WG3049> of<WG2596> grace<WG5485>, but<WG235> of<WG2596> debt<WG3783>.

But<WG1161> to him that worketh<WG2038> not<WG3361>, but<WG1161> believeth<WG4100> on<WG1909> him that justifieth<WG1344> the ungodly<WG765>, his<WG846> faith<WG4102> is counted<WG3049> for<WG1519> righteousness<WG1343>.

Even as<WG2509> David<WG1138> also<WG2532> describeth<WG3004> the blessedness<WG3108> of the man<WG444>, unto whom<WG3739> God<WG2316> imputeth<WG3049> righteousness<WG1343> without<WG5565> works<WG2041>,
Saying, Blessed<WG3107> are they whose<WG3739> iniquities<WG458> are forgiven<WG863>, and<WG2532> whose<WG3739> sins<WG266> are covered<WG1943>.
Blessed<WG3107> is the man<WG435> to whom<WG3739> the Lord<WG2962> will<WG3049> not<WG3364> impute<WG3049> sin<WG266>.

Cometh this<WG3778> blessedness<WG3108> then<WG3767> upon<WG1909> the circumcision<WG4061> only, or<WG2228> upon<WG1909> the uncircumcision<WG203> also<WG2532>? for<WG1063> we say<WG3004> that<WG3754> faith<WG4102> was reckoned<WG3049> to Abraham<WG11> for<WG1519> righteousness<WG1343>.

How<WG4459> was it<WG3049> then<WG3767> reckoned<WG3049>? when he was<WG5607> in<WG1722> circumcision<WG4061>, or<WG2228> in<WG1722> uncircumcision<WG203>? Not<WG3756> in<WG1722> circumcision<WG4061>, but<WG235> in<WG1722> uncircumcision<WG203>.

And<WG2532> he received<WG2983> the sign<WG4592> of circumcision<WG4061>, a seal<WG4973> of the righteousness<WG1343> of the faith<WG4102> which<WG3588> he had yet being<WG1722> uncircumcised<WG203>: that<WG1519> he<WG846> might be<WG1511> the father<WG3962> of all<WG3956> them that believe<WG4100>, though<WG1223> they be not circumcised<WG203>; that<WG1519> righteousness<WG1343> might be imputed<WG3049> unto them<WG846> also<WG2532>:

And<WG2532> the father<WG3962> of circumcision<WG4061> to them who are not<WG3756> of<WG1537> the circumcision<WG4061> only<WG3440>, but<WG235> who also<WG2532> walk<WG4748> in the steps<WG2487> of that faith<WG4102> of our<WG2257> father<WG3962> Abraham<WG11>, which he had being<WG1722> yet uncircumcised<WG203>.

For<WG1063> the promise<WG1860>, that he should be<WG1511> the<WG846> heir<WG2818> of the world<WG2889>, was not<WG3756> to Abraham<WG11>, or<WG2228> to his<WG846> seed<WG4690>, through<WG1223> the law<WG3551>, but<WG235> through<WG1223> the righteousness<WG1343> of faith<WG4102>.
For<WG1063> if<WG1487> they which are of<WG1537> the law<WG3551> be heirs<WG2818>, faith<WG4102> is made void<WG2758>, and<WG2532> the promise<WG1860> made of none effect<WG2673>:
Because<WG1063> the law<WG3551> worketh<WG2716> wrath<WG3709>: for<WG1063> where<WG3757> no<WG3756> law<WG3551> is<WG2076>, there is no<WG3761> transgression<WG3847>.

Therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> it is of<WG1537> faith<WG4102>, that<WG2443> it might be by<WG2596> grace<WG5485>; to the end<WG1519> the promise<WG1860> might be<WG1511> sure<WG949> to all<WG3956> the seed<WG4690>; not<WG3756> to that only<WG3440> which is of<WG1537> the law<WG3551>, but<WG235> to that also<WG2532> which is of<WG1537> the faith<WG4102> of Abraham<WG11>; who<WG3739> is<WG2076> the father<WG3962> of us<WG2257> all<WG3956>,

(As<WG2531> it is written<WG1125>,<WG3754> I have made<WG5087> thee<WG4571> a father<WG3962> of many<WG4183> nations<WG1484>,) before<WG2713> him whom<WG3739> he believed<WG4100>, even God<WG2316>, who quickeneth<WG2227> the dead<WG3498>, and<WG2532> calleth<WG2564> those things which be<WG5607> not<WG3361> as though<WG5613> they were<WG5607>. before him: or, like unto him

Who<WG3739> against<WG3844> hope<WG1680> believed<WG4100> in<WG1909> hope<WG1680>, that<WG1519> he<WG846> might become<WG1096> the father<WG3962> of many<WG4183> nations<WG1484>; according<WG2596> to that which was spoken<WG2046>, So<WG3779> shall<WG2071> thy<WG4675> seed<WG4690> be<WG2071>.

And<WG2532> being not<WG3361> weak<WG770> in faith<WG4102>, he considered<WG2657> not<WG3756> his own<WG1438> body<WG4983> now<WG2235> dead<WG3499>, when he was<WG5225> about<WG4225> an hundred years old<WG1541>, neither yet<WG2532> the deadness<WG3500> of Sarah's<WG4564> womb<WG3388>:

<WG1161> He staggered<WG1252> not<WG3756> at<WG1519> the promise<WG1860> of God<WG2316> through unbelief<WG570>; but<WG235> was strong<WG1743> in faith<WG4102>, giving<WG1325> glory<WG1391> to God<WG2316>;
And<WG2532> being fully persuaded<WG4135> that<WG3754>, what<WG3739> he had promised<WG1861>, he was<WG2076> able<WG1415> also<WG2532> to perform<WG4160>.
And<WG2532> therefore<WG1352> it was imputed<WG3049> to him<WG846> for<WG1519> righteousness<WG1343>.
Now<WG1161> it was<WG1125> not<WG3756> written<WG1125> for his sake<WG1223> <WG846> alone<WG3440>, that<WG3754> it was imputed<WG3049> to him<WG846>;

But<WG235> for<WG1223> us<WG2248> also<WG2532>, to whom<WG3739> it shall be<WG3195> imputed<WG3049>, if we believe<WG4100> on<WG1909> him that raised up<WG1453> Jesus<WG2424> our<WG2257> Lord<WG2962> from<WG1537> the dead<WG3498>;
Who<WG3739> was delivered<WG3860> for<WG1223> our<WG2257> offences<WG3900>, and<WG2532> was raised again<WG1453> for<WG1223> our<WG2257> justification<WG1347>.
